title: 【請廣傳】英文 timeline 整合 post

replies.msg:
Timeline:
14:20: Starting time. Started early with a filled Victoria Park, the designed venue of the protest.
14:30: Designated starting time.
15:10: Traffic control at MTR Island Line stations. Crowds gathered in MTR stations in Kowloon to reach the Hong Kong Island by ferry.
15:50: The first wave of protesters reached the Central Government Complex.
16:20: Demands increased for opening blockaded roads in Causeway Bay. Conflicts erupted at Canal Road Flyover with a police warning of "Stop charging or we use force".
16:50: All parts of Hennessy Road opened after massive protests.
17:00: First arrest of protesters.
18:25: Seven protesters were arrested.
18:55: Hong Kong Police Force stated that 150 thousands protesters began their march at Victoria Park.
20:00 Pepper Spray usage by police was reported at Admiralty Centre.
20:25: Tension arose after pepper spray usage at Admiralty Centre. Demosistō demanded for a conversation with Carrie Lam and John Lee.
20:40: Special Tactical Squad was seen on guard at Admiralty Centre.
21:45: Civil Human Rights Front declared that 1.03 million protesters attended the rally, opposing the police number of 24 thousands.
22:00: The organiser, Civil Human Rights Front, signified for the end of the march. This is one of the biggest movement in Hong Kong history.
22:35: Studentlocalism and Hong Kong Independence Union urged protesters to stay at Legco until 12 June in a silent form of protest.
23:20: Governmental response stated the Second Reading debate of the Extradition Law will resume at 12 June, ignoring the will of the 1.03 million protesters.
23:40: Police started their clearance attempts at Admiralty Centre.
00:10: Pepper spray and tear gas used at the protesters storming the Legco.
00:25: Police increased the number of riot control officers. Many carried Remington 870 shotgun, shields and tear gas.
00:40: Police condemned the protesters storming the Legco and urged the protesters to leave the premises.
00:50: Special Tactical Squad began to release pepper spray in a wide spread manner, putting a distance between protesters and the police as evictions began.
01:00: Protesters gathered in Lung Wo Road, tying up crowd control barriers with more police arriving.
01:20: 2 protesters were arrested during the eviction attempt by the police at Admiralty Centre.
01:34: Police carrying guns started another clearance attempt. Tear gas was utilised.
01:35: Police drove protesters back to the pavement after tactical reform, violating the freedom of association by actively attacking the protesters.
02:07: Protesters moved the crowd control barriers to Gloucester Road, occupying it.
02:18: Reports that groups of police beating protesters in dark corners were received.
02:31: Police reinforcing in Wan Chai as protesters were retreating from Gloucester Road to Causeway Bay.
02:45 The Commissioner of Police Stephen Lo held a news conference with reporters.
02:36: Protesters gathering in Civic Square in front of the Central Government Complex were forcefully removed.
03:00: Police forced the protesters to a small part of the pavement out of the Old Wan Chai Police Station at Gloucester Road, almost leading to a stampede and caused a number of injuries. Some protesters had lost consciousness after being beaten by the police.
03:18: Riot control officers were chasing citizens in Wan Chai in a curfew-esque manner. News reports had been cut off and no live news could be reported.
04:17: A crackdown were undergoing in Admiralty and Wan Chai.
04:39: Police were also spotted in Mong Kok, locating in the Kowloon Peninsula, investigating random passerby.
--
For more information, please contact me.
Sapphire Law
